attributes.action: outlaw any Hamas contact until charter is changed
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
There have been reports of UK officials meeting Hamas affiliated politicians. 

The basic ideology of Hamas rules out prospects for a peaceful 2-state solution, thus the gov’t should outlaw any contact until they change their charter.

Anti-Peace: 

Article 13 states: Initiatives and so-called peaceful solutions … are in contradiction to the principles of the Islamic Resistance Movement [Hamas]. 

Islamic extremism: 
Article 8 (slogan): …Jihad is its path and death for the sake of Allah is the loftiest of its wishes. 

The charter is rife with hatred …. Accusing the undefined ‘enemy’ of being behind World War I, WW II, the French and Communist Revolutions, forming secret societies, such as the Freemasons, Rotary Clubs and others, controlling world media, news agencies, the press, publishing houses, broadcasting stations, referring to the anti-Semitic ‘Protocols of the Elders of Zion’.
We want: No lawful contact until they change their stance!

rejection.details: Unfortunately you must confirm that you are a British citizen before we can consider your e-petitions. Please contact number10@petitions.pm.gov.uk.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
